quiz.question: What is the common name for a writing system where each symbol stands for a syllable?

Which system marks thousands in Roman numerals using an overline?

Which 19th-century scholar deciphered Linear B in 1952 using comparative linguistic methods?
Which code used long and short signals to encode letters and numbers?

Which writing system invented by Sequoyah assigns syllabic characters to Cherokee sounds?
What is the primary purpose of the International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA)?
Who popularized binary arithmetic in the West with an influential 1703 paper?
Which numeric base underlies standard timekeeping divisions of minutes and seconds?
